passage_text: Arkansas CNA Salary. The average salary for nursing assistants in Arkansas as of October 2010 was $29,000 annually. Experience weighs in on the rate of pay, as does quality of work and care provided. Some beginning CNAs may start out at around $20,000 a year and aides with years of experience can make much higher than the state average.

Average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings in Alaska are 26% lower than average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings nationwide. The average salary ranks 47th among states in the country.

Average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings in Alabama are 1% higher than average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings nationwide. The average salary ranks 9th among states in the country.
Average CNA salaries for job postings in Arkansas are 2% higher than average CNA salaries for job postings nationwide.
Average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings in Arkansas are 2% higher than average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings nationwide.

CNAs in the United States are earning an average salary of $27,000/yr. CNAs in Arkansas are earning a comparative average salary of $25,000/yr. The salary averages for the five largest cities in Arkansas are as follows: Little Rock: $21,000/yr.

Average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings in Arkansas are 1% higher than average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings nationwide. The average salary ranks 13th among states in the country.

Average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings in Arizona are 18% lower than average Certified Nursing Assistant salaries for job postings nationwide. The average salary ranks 43rd among states in the country.
